comment._content: This is one prison I have been to. It's a wonderful place, and recommended. I don't think this building is still there - it looks as if it was the Governor's house outside the walls, and the children might be his (?). Lack of a garden and footpath implies it was newly built. There is a doppelganger print in the same series - investigator.records.nsw.gov.au/asp/photosearch/photo.asp... . Most of the photos of Trial Bay in Photo Investigator have doubles for some reason. I think they are all (in the 4481 series) contemporary with the new gaol just nearing completion and about to open in 1886 www.migrationheritage.nsw.gov.au/exhibitions/zivillager/h... .
